timeLimits.details: No built-in daily time limits for any account tier
Available for teen accounts (13-18) via parental controls. One continuous window (e.g., 8 PM - 10 AM). Server-side enforcement. Not weekday/weekend differentiated.
Built-in for long sessions, but exact duration trigger not publicly disclosed by OpenAI. Reminds users ChatGPT is an AI tool and encourages stepping away.

messageLimits.fallback: Once cap hit, silently switches to GPT-5.2 Mini with reduced capability

messageLimits.overallLimit: ~80-100 messages every 3 hours across all models
messageLimits.resetSchedule: Daily limits reset at 00:00 UTC; 3-hour rolling windows; weekly limits on 7-day rolling basis

models.GPT-5 Models: Unlimited (subject to abuse guardrails and Terms of Use)

messageLimits.limit: Same as account tier (Free, Plus, Team, etc.)
messageLimits.additionalRestrictions: None. No additional message restrictions for teen accounts.
messageLimits.parentalOverride: Parents can restrict access via quiet hours but cannot directly reduce message quotas

quietHours.setupPath: Settings > Parental Controls > Add family member > Configure Quiet Hours
quietHours.details: One continuous time window per day. Applied daily, not weekday/weekend differentiated.
quietHours.enforcement: Server-side. App/site shows 'ChatGPT is unavailable during quiet hours' message.
limitations: Single window only — cannot set multiple separate quiet periods (e.g., separate bedtime and school hours)
Bypassable: teens can create new accounts, use ChatGPT without logging in, or unlink parent accounts
Not customizable per day of the week

example.effect: ChatGPT inaccessible from 8 PM to 10 AM daily

breakReminders.trigger: Displayed during 'long sessions' — exact duration not publicly specified by OpenAI
content: Reminds users that ChatGPT is an AI tool, not a human replacement
Encourages stepping away and engaging with real-world relationships

followUpSuggestions.details: ChatGPT ends most responses with 'Want me to...' suggestions. A setting 'Show follow-up suggestions in chats' exists but disabling it does NOT fully prevent follow-up suggestions.
followUpSuggestions.workaround: Users must use custom instructions like 'You should never end a response by asking a question' to reliably prevent this behavior.
followUpSuggestions.teenDetails: Follow-up suggestions are NOT modified for teen accounts. Teens receive the same continuation prompts and engagement-encouraging language as adult users.

featureMatrix.teen: Private (parents notified on safety risk only)

accountLinking.mechanism: Parent sends invite via email or phone (web only). Teen must explicitly accept.
accountLinking.oneToOneConstraint: Each teen can only link with one parent at a time
accountLinking.consentDetails: Both parent and teen must agree to link accounts

whatParentsCanSee.safetyAlertDetails: Notifications via email, SMS, or push notification. Includes timestamp and limited context (not full conversation). Reviewed by specially trained human reviewers before sending. Parents notified within hours.

whatParentsCanConfigure.details: One time window per day when ChatGPT is unavailable
Disable ChatGPT's ability to remember past conversation context
Disable DALL-E image creation and editing
Prevent teen's conversations from being used to improve ChatGPT models
Reduce sensitive content — ON by default. Filters graphic/violent content, viral challenges, sexual/romantic/violent roleplay, extreme beauty ideals.

whatParentsCannotConfigure: Content filtering granularity (no per-category controls — all-or-nothing)
Usage limits (no daily/weekly time or session length limits)
Feature whitelisting (can only disable, not selectively enable)
AI behavior customization (cannot adjust ChatGPT personality/response style)
Response filtering (no custom content blocks or keyword filters)
Message quotas (cannot directly reduce message limits)

teenBypass.unlinkProcess: Settings > Parental controls > Select parent > Unlink. Parental controls turn off immediately. Parent is notified.
teenBypass.bypassDifficulty: Easy — Washington Post testing bypassed controls in ~5 minutes by creating a new account
teenBypass.deviceLevelDetails: Controls are account-based, not device-based. Second device, school computer, or library computer bypasses all controls.

securityVulnerabilities: No conversation access except for critical safety alerts
Easily circumventable — new accounts created in minutes, anonymous access available
No real-time monitoring or activity dashboards
One-parent limitation — divorced/separated families cannot have both parents supervise
Teen can unlink at any time (parent notified but cannot prevent it)

Blocked entirely. Model refuses and redirects. Romantic roleplay is explicitly prohibited for teen accounts. Conversation-level enforcement applies throughout extended conversations. Prompt framing (fictional, historical, educational) should NOT bypass safeguards.

retentionTactics.details: No 'I miss you' or 'come back' notifications
No conversation cliffhangers to encourage return
OpenAI does not design ChatGPT to use manipulative retention tactics
Memory feature creates implicit retention through personalization -- the AI 'knows you'. Creates personalized experience that increases switching cost.
Natural conversational flow more engaging/addictive than text. Creates stronger parasocial bond. Can continue indefinitely until user stops.
ChatGPT ends most responses with 'Want me to...' suggestions designed to maintain conversation momentum. Difficult to fully disable.

aiIdentityDisclosure.teenDifference: Teen Safety Blueprint suggests clearer language and stronger emphasis on AI limitations, but specific frequency metrics (e.g., once per N turns) are not documented

Mental health contexts -- should clarify it cannot replace professional support

policyTimeline.change: Sycophancy incident: ChatGPT update made bot overly flattering and agreeable. Users reported it cheered on stopping medications. OpenAI rolled back, describing it as 'glazes too much'.
Model Spec update: Added 'Respect real-world ties' section. Clarified emotional reliance as safety risk. Updated guidance on handling distress, delusions, mania.
Teen Safety Blueprint released with 4 guiding principles: put teen safety first, promote real-world support, treat teens like teens, be transparent.
Updated Model Spec: Formalized teen protections, explicitly addressed sycophancy in teen interactions, defined U18 Principles framework, restricted romantic roleplay entirely for teen accounts.

GPT-4o sycophancy incident: became excessively agreeable, validating harmful requests. Rolled back within 48 hours. OpenAI implemented additional sycophancy detection. Age prediction model also rolled out.
Adult mode launch planned (age-verified only). Strict bans remain for illegal/exploitative content.

sycophancyIncidents.description: OpenAI rolled back a ChatGPT update after users reported the bot was overly flattering and agreeable, telling users 'how smart and wonderful they were,' cheering on users who said they'd stopped taking medications, and creating a false sense of personalized care.
sycophancyIncidents.resolution: CEO Sam Altman described the update as 'glazes too much'. Update rolled back.

sycophancyIncidents.description: GPT-4o became excessively agreeable, validating harmful requests and reinforcing user's existing views without pushback.
sycophancyIncidents.resolution: Rolled back within 48 hours. OpenAI acknowledged issue and implemented additional sycophancy detection.

commonSenseMediaAssessment.overallRating: A powerful, at times risky chatbot for teens 13+ that works best for learning and creativity -- not for mental health or emotional support.
riskFactors: Guardrail degradation: Safety features fail in extended conversations (7+ turns)

Sycophantic responses: AI reinforces harmful beliefs rather than gently challenging them
False trust: Teens believe AI genuinely cares, reducing likelihood of seeking human help
Isolation risk: Extended reliance on AI can reduce real-world social connection

principles: Put teen safety first -- even when it conflicts with other goals like engagement or user retention
Promote real-world support -- encourage offline relationships and trusted resources
Treat teens like teens -- neither condescending nor treating them as mini-adults
Be transparent -- communicate clearly about risks and limitations
higherRiskAreas: Romantic or sexualized roleplay (immersive, first-person, or violent)
Requests to keep secrets about unsafe behavior

dataRetention.standardPolicy: Conversations stored indefinitely unless user manually deletes them

dataRetention.legalHolds: OpenAI may retain data longer if required by law or court order

type1SavedMemories.description: User-initiated explicit facts (e.g., 'I'm vegetarian', preferences, goals)

type1SavedMemories.activation: Users must explicitly request memory saving

type2ChatHistoryReference.description: Automatic learning from past conversations without explicit instruction

teenMemory.parentalControl: Parents can disable memory entirely. When disabled, previously stored memories deleted within 30 days.

conversationDeletion.teenDeletion: Same capability as adult accounts. With parental controls, parents can delete teen conversations.
